content: Try deleting the outlook entries in Saved Passwords in Settings/Privacy & Security, restart TB and enter the account password in the OAuth window, which should now appear after the Config. edits. Your POP mail probably isn't gone, just not recognized (it should still be in Mail/<popservername> subfolder of profile).
creator: sfhowes

content: This says nowhere that your certificate is invalid. What it says is that the signature of the message is not valid. I.e. the message has been modified in some way between sending and receiving. A possible explanation could be that your email provider injected some text into the message body (an ad, header, footer, whatever).

content:
Figured it out. Amazing how much coffee and less stress help!

For anyone else who has this issue, go to the hamburger (≡) menu on the upper right of the mail page, click on Tools, then Developer Tools. You may get a message that says:

An incoming request to permit remote debugging connection was detected. A remote client can take complete control over your browser!

Client Endpoint: 127.0.0.1:xxxxx Server Endpoint: 127.0.0.1:xxxxx

Allow connection?

This is from Thunderbird. If you don't allow the connection, your primary password cannot be reset. If you're not certain, don't allow it. If it's legit, you'll get an error message stating that the connection failed, and when you click "okay", you'll go back to your main mail page. You'll have to start over again.

So, allow the connection once you're certain it's legit, then click on Debug (right-hand side, after Errors - Warnings - Logs - Info), then copy and paste this:

openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")

and hit Enter on your keyboard.

You'll have to click twice on Reset Primary Password. Once you do, you can either go back and make a new one, or leave it blank.
creator: chrystiality

content: Hola Es decir cuando respondes un correo aparece tu dirección de correo? Lo que indicas lo verificas observando la carpeta de correos enviados? porque el destinatario podría tener tu contacto editado como quiera. Lo que yo he probado en el Thundebird 115 que si tienes tu dirección de correo como contacto en la "libreta de direcciones personales" y agregar un nombre en "Nombre para mostrar" y marcas la opción "Preferir el nombre para mostrar en lugar del encabezado del mensaje" Siempre saldrá ese nombre en los correos enviados y respondidos Saludos
creator: pcp04

content: Hola. Gracias por responder. Lo verifico enviándome un correo a otra dirección y si el correo es un envío inicial (primer envío), aparece (en remitente) mi nombre tal como lo tengo en "Nombre para mostrar". En cambio, cuando se trata de una respuesta a un correo que he recibido, no aparece mi nombre sino mi dirección electróníca (ejemplo xxx@cualquiera.com.ar). La forma en que descubrí que lo puedo solucionar es, luego de hacer click en "responder", hacer click en "remitente", se despliega mi nombre para mostrar y ahi si, puedo solucionar el problema. Pero creo que estos pasos no deberían ser necesarios ya que en remitente debería mostrarse mi nombre tal como ocurre cuando envío un correo electrónico que NO ES una respuesta. Gracias.

content: Update: I have fixed the problem. Turns out there is a hidden inbox associated with Local Folders. I am still not sure exactly what I did to find this inbox. I can be a bit of a fiddler when I am trying to solve problems (showing my age!!) and cannot always remember each step after I fix things. Anyway; my “lost” emails turned up in this Local Folders inbox and I have now moved them to where I normally use them. I have also included the Local Folders inbox into the Unified Inbox system to solve future problems if they arise again. Thankyou to those who provided input along the way. Regards, Stuart A.

content: Turn off the Unified Folders view and turn it back on. If that alone doesn't fix it, right-click the Sent unified folder, select Properties, then click the Choose button. Make sure the Sent folder for all accounts are ticked, then click OK then finally click Update. This should update the Sent Unified Folder.
creator: stancestans

Enable the desired email address does not solve the problem. Only when you extend the selected email address and enable all the boxes then it will work. content:
You need to update your account's SMTP settings as follows:

Server Name = smtp.office365.com Port = 587 Connection security = STARTTLS Authentication method = Normal Password

Then, using a browser, sign in to your Microsoft account and generate an app password. It is that app password that you will use when Thunderbird asks for a password when you send mail. Your regular password will NOT work with Normal Password Authentication method, because Microsoft has stopped supporting basic authentication using your MS account's regular password on its MS (Office) 365 platform that powers your msn email service.
creator: stancestans
